title: 'You should've never been born': How Buss family infighting drove the $10B sale of the Lakers
content: The post-Jerry Buss era was defined by resentment, dysfunction and conflict -- and ended with the loss of the most valuable family-owned franchise in the world.

title: Mets strike again, add ace Peralta from Brewers
content: The Mets' winterlong pursuit of a front-line starting pitcher ended Wednesday with them acquiring All-Star Freddy Peralta and right-hander Tobias Myers from the Brewers for prospects Brandon Sproat and Jett Williams.

title: GM Lynch: Aiyuk has played last snap for 49ers
content: At Wednesday's end-of-season news conference, 49ers general manager John Lynch confirmed what has been obvious for months: WR Brandon Aiyuk will not return to the only NFL team he has ever known.

title: Knicks win by franchise-best 54, end 4-game skid
content: The Knicks ended their four-game losing streak Wednesday night with the most lopsided victory in franchise history, beating the Nets 120-66.

title: Stidham, Broncos keep prep as normal as possible
content: Quarterback Jarrett Stidham, set to make his first start in two years in Sunday's AFC Championship Game, and the Broncos have tried to stick to the team's usual routines.

title: Rams' Adams again at doorstep of 'mythical' SB
content: Davante Adams will be playing in his fifth NFC Championship Game when the Rams visit the Seahawks, but he's still looking for his first trip to the Super Bowl.

title: Keys, Pegula advance in all-American matchups
content: In a pair of matches between American women, defending champion Madison Keys survived a challenge from Ashlyn Krueger and Jessica Pegula defeated McCartney Kessler.

title: Niners' injury probe includes looking into substation
content: Niners GM John Lynch said the team will look into "everything" to find out why injuries continue to pile up year after year, including an investigation into the viral electrical substation conspiracy theory.

title: Tucker: Dodgers' pedigree made decision 'easier'
content: Kyle Tucker was introduced by the Dodgers on Wednesday and he said the decision to pick L.A. over the Mets and Blue Jays was made easier because of the team's championship pedigree.

content: What are the biggest questions hovering above all 30 teams midway through the season, and where do the teams land in this week's rankings?

content: Where will national title game standouts Fernando Mendoza and Akheem Mesidor land in Round 1? And could we really see six WRs in the opening 32 picks?

content: We're nine months from the 2026 season starting, but we're looking at every power team's QB situation.

content: As 12 teams face off for gold in Milan Cortina, here are the players who will have the biggest impact.

content: Russia is suspended from international competition due to the war in Ukraine, sidelining many players.

title: Liberty, Fever among the top 2026 WNBA schedule reveals on social media
content: The 2026 WNBA schedule is out and teams announced their calendar in their own creative ways on social media.

title: UCL talking points: Matchday 8's must-see games, Man City's slump, more
content: What's at stake on the final matchday? Is it time to rule a line through Man City? ESPN's experts answer all the burning questions from the Champions League's penultimate group matches.

title: Welcoming the HOF Class of 2026: Why Carlos Beltran and Andruw Jones got in
content: Cooperstown welcomed two new players Tuesday night. Here's why the center fielders are headed to the Hall.

title: Baseball Hall of Fame voting winners, losers and who could get in next
content: The results are in! Our experts break down the highs and lows of the 2026 vote and look ahead to 2027.

title: Questions on NFL draft's top 10 picks: Would the Raiders trade the No. 1 pick? Will the Chiefs go RB?
content: We're three months away from the 2026 NFL draft. What's the latest on each team picking in the top 10? Our reporters weigh in.

title: Stacking the NBA's most valuable players at 10 distinct skills: Where SGA ranks No. 1
content: Who needs the eye test? This metric shows the NBA's best players at several categories based on every line of the play-by-play.

title: Reranking men's college basketball Freshman of the Year contenders
content: Darryn Peterson has finally entered the top 10, along with two other players. Cameron Boozer remains No. 1.

title: Bracketology: Don't write off Houston just yet
content: The Cougars remain national title contenders despite falling off the radar at the turn of the calendar year.

title: Power Rankings: Iowa, Ohio State soar into top 10 -- but can they stay there?
content: The Big Ten and Big 12 are winners as Ohio State, Iowa and Baylor crack the top 10. UConn stays No. 1.

title: Bracketology: Big nonconference win boosts Ohio State to a 3-seed
content: Results Sunday and Monday shook up the top 16, and the Buckeyes benefited the most, climbing two seed lines.

title: Are Patriots QB Drake Maye's turnovers an issue against the Broncos?
content: The Broncos' defense is the best in the league at getting to the quarterback. How will the Patriots respond?

title: MMA Rank 50-1: Which stars could shine the brightest in 2026?
content: Makhachev, Topruia or Chimaev? ESPN ranks the top 50 fighters in MMA based on how they will perform in 2026.

title: CFP takeaways: Even as a favored Goliath, Indiana's win stands alone in sports history
content: Put it next to the Miracle on Ice or NC State and Villanova. In a wild title game, here's how Indiana beat Miami.

title: Wetzel: Hoosiers delivered a national title for the everyman
content: Curt Cignetti's relentless group of discards and misfits showed what the transfer portal made possible.

title: Vinícius Júnior's future at Real Madrid: Stay, exit or run contract down?
content: Vinícius Júnior has returned to form for Real Madrid, but what should he do about his future at the club? Here are his options.

title: USMNT World Cup big board 4.0: Pochettino's roster coming into focus
content: We're less than five months away from the USMNT's World Cup opener, and with the clock ticking down, Mauricio Pochettino's squad is coming into focus.

title: How to bet the American Express: Is it worth betting on Scottie Scheffler to win?
content: The second stop of the PGA Tour brings us short, scorable courses and Scottie Scheffler's first start.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United looking at move for Casadó
content: Manchester United are exploring their options over a move for Barcelona midfielder Marc Casadó. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: ‘Manual frisking’ misused: South Korean woman alleges assault at Bengaluru airport
content: A South Korean businesswoman was allegedly sexually assaulted by an airline ground-handling employee at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport. The 32-year-old woman reported being subjected to "manual frisking" by the staff member under the guise of a baggage issue. The accused, identified as Mohammed Affaann Ahmed, has been arrested and charged under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

title: Noida techie's death: New clip shows last-moment attempt to save Yuvraj Mehta — video
content: A chilling video captures software engineer Yuvraj Mehta's final moments, trapped in a deep, unbarricaded excavation pit after his car plunged in. For nearly 90 minutes, his phone's torch and cries for help pierced the dense fog, but rescue efforts were tragically hampered by the depth and conditions, ultimately failing to reach him in time.

title: Operation Trashi-I: Day 5 sees fresh encounter in J&K's Kishtwar
content: Security forces engaged in a fresh gunfight with holed-up terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district on Thursday. The ongoing "Operation Trashi-I," launched Sunday, intensified as a search team encountered a group of two to three foreign terrorists, believed to be Jaish-e-Mohammad operatives, in Singhpora's dense forests.

title: Faceoff in Karnataka assembly: Ruckus over VB-G RAM G bill; guv snubs speech, walks off
content: Karnataka Governor Thawarchand Gehlot walked out of the legislature after reading only two lines of his address, refusing to read cabinet-approved paragraphs critical of the Centre. This triggered a political storm, with the government accusing the BJP of influencing the Governor and the opposition alleging politicization of the address.

title: T20 WC: ICC rejects Bangladesh plea — Pakistan disappointed but won’t withdraw
content: Pakistan expressed disappointment as the International Cricket Council rejected Bangladesh's request to move T20 World Cup matches from India, despite Pakistan backing Bangladesh's stance in principle. However, Pakistan has clarified that withdrawing from the tournament is not an option, as they are already scheduled to play at a neutral venue.

title: Macron urges more Chinese FDI, EU-China rebalance; Beijing calls for fair treatment
content: French President Macron urged China to boost investment in Europe, citing a need for technology transfer and growth, while criticizing US trade practices. Beijing responded, emphasizing mutual benefit and R&D as drivers of its competitiveness, and expressed hope for a fair European market for Chinese businesses.

title: Watch: Trump defends inviting Putin to Board of Peace despite Greenland 'threat'
content: President Trump defended inviting Vladimir Putin to his proposed Board of Peace, despite earlier concerns about Russia's intentions in Greenland. Trump stated the board prioritizes leaders who 'get the job done' and possess significant influence, regardless of controversy. Analysts suggest Greenland tensions benefit Russia by potentially weakening NATO unity.

title: THE Subject Rankings 2026: IISc Bangalore stands alone for India in global top 100
content: Indian universities made a limited impact in the THE World University Rankings by Subject 2026, with only IISc Bangalore breaking into the global top 100 for Computer Science. While US and UK institutions dominated, China showed growing strength, securing seven top-10 positions across subjects. India's subject-level performance remains narrow, highlighting a challenge in building global competitiveness beyond elite institutions.

title: Why Rich Dad Poor Dad author thinks silver is superior to gold
content: Financial author Robert Kiyosaki declared silver superior to gold in the Technology Age, calling it an "economic structural metal." He highlighted its price surge and predicted it would hit $200 an ounce in 2026. This comes as silver and gold reach record highs globally due to safe-haven demand, supply tightness, and geopolitical risks.

title: Ads in ChatGPT? Google AI CEO flags OpenAI's new experiment; terms it 'premature '
content: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis stated no plans for ads in Gemini, deeming OpenAI's ChatGPT ad test a premature revenue push. This comes amid investor concerns about OpenAI's significant spending exceeding revenue, with projections of substantial cumulative losses and unsustainable operational costs for its AI tools.

title: Kerala youth suicide: Woman who posted bus harassment clip arrested for abetment
content: Police apprehended Shimjitha Mustafa, accused of abetting suicide in connection with a man's death following her sexual harassment allegations on a bus.  The man's family claims false accusations led to his demise.  Protests erupted over the arrest's timing and alleged police leniency, with the family demanding stricter charges.

title: Noida techie's death: Developer flagged sewer collapse in 2022; Yuvraj drowns 4 years later
content: Developer Wiztown Planners had warned Noida Authority about hazardous conditions at a Sector 150 plot in March 2022, citing flooded basements due to collapsed sewer lines. Despite these warnings and repeated concerns from residents and other departments, no permanent remedial measures were taken, leading to the fatal accident of a software engineer.

title: Students and AI: Google CEO on reveals Gemini’s free offer; read details
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai announced a free SAT preparation tool powered by Gemini AI for students. Learners can now take full-length practice exams within the Gemini app, receiving instant feedback and personalized insights. This initiative, using vetted content from The Princeton Review, aims to help students identify knowledge gaps and build confidence for their exams.

title: Candace Owens’ claims about Erika Kirk’s parents spark outrage on social media
content: Candace Owens sparked intense backlash after suggesting links between Erika Kirk’s family and alleged child-related crimes. Critics accused her of crossing a moral line by implying sex trafficking connections without evidence. Social media erupted, with even conservative voices calling the remarks reckless and harmful. The controversy has reignited debate over ethics, influence, and responsibility in political commentary.

title: Exclusive: 'Test cricket is pinnacle, but T20 cricket ensures financial stability' — Steve Waugh
content: Steve Waugh, co-owner of Amsterdam Flames in European T20 Premier League (ETPL), bats for the survival of Test cricket but admitted that playing in the T20 leagues provides current cricketers stability and regular income. The 60-year-old also maintained that Test cricket will survive because top cricketers of the world still want to play the game's ultimate format.

title: Shunted IAS officer is MCD chief; vacated stadium in 2022 to walk his dog
content: Sanjeev Khirwar, a 1994-batch IAS officer, has been appointed as the new municipal commissioner of Delhi. This comes over three years after he was transferred out of the capital following a controversy involving walking his dog at Thyagaraj Stadium, which allegedly disrupted athletes' training.

title: MLB trade rumors: Phillies target $7.7mn Red Sox OF for 2026 shakeup
content: Philadelphia Phillies are reportedly eyeing Boston Red Sox outfielder Jarren Duran to bolster their struggling outfield for the 2026 season. Duran offers much-needed speed, defense, and consistent offense, fitting Philadelphia's immediate needs. A potential trade involving Alec Bohm and prospects could reshape both teams, addressing Philadelphia's outfield woes while providing Boston with key pieces.

title: Who is Cece? Twitch streamer at the center of Marvel Rivals Creator Cup controversy
content: Twitch streamer Cecee faced online backlash after a heated incident during a Marvel Rivals tournament.  She insulted a teammate during a live match.  Cecee later apologized, admitting her mistakes as team captain.  She stated she reacted emotionally and failed to de-escalate the situation.  The streamer promised to improve her leadership skills.

title: Patrick Mahomes quote of the day: Never lose hope in tough times
content: Patrick Mahomes might be a young player but the Kansas City Chiefs' star quarterback has easily inspired a generation of fans both on and off the field. As many of the Chiefs' fans remain stressed about his potential return to the field in the next season, Patrick Mahomes' words prove that he is not the one to give up very easily.

title: WEF Davos: Trump projects $600 bn in US tariff revenue; claims bigger inflows next year
content: President Trump announced the US expects to receive around $600 billion in tariff revenue this year, with more anticipated next year. He linked this to increased investments, citing Apple's $650 billion commitment and Toyota's plans, attributing the surge to election clarity and his administration's protective tariff policy.

title: Honour killing in Moradabad? Interfaith couple thrashed to death; girl's brother held
content: Bodies of a 24-year-old man and an 18-year-old woman from different communities, who had been missing for three days, were discovered in Moradabad district. Police suspect honour killing, with the woman's brothers arrested for allegedly killing the couple and burying their bodies near a temple.

title: 1984 anti-Sikh riots case: Delhi court acquits ex-Congress MP Sajjan Kumar
content: A Delhi court has acquitted former Congress leader Sajjan Kumar in a 1984 anti-Sikh riots case where two people died. The court found the prosecution unable to prove Kumar's involvement in the violence. Kumar had consistently denied any role and stated no evidence linked him to the incident.

title: Putin responds to Trump’s ‘Board of Peace’ invite — what’s the $1bn frozen-asset offer?
content: President Putin has offered to use Russian assets frozen in the US for Ukraine's reconstruction post-peace treaty. He also proposed a $1 billion contribution from these funds to Donald Trump's Gaza peace initiative, a plan discussed with Washington and set for further talks with Trump's envoys.  This move aims to appeal to the US president and potentially avert further sanctions.

title: Gold, silver price prediction: Will gold hit Rs 1.75 lakh/10 grams in coming sessions?
content: Gold and silver price prediction today: Abhilash Koikkara of Nuvama Professional Clients Group is of the view that gold and silver prices may continue to trend upwards, with the possibility of gold touching Rs 1.75 lakh per 10 grams in the coming sessions.

title: Woman grabs Rohit Sharma at team hotel, cries 'please help me' — Watch
content: Cricket star Rohit Sharma experienced a security scare when a woman, seeking funds for her daughter's life-saving treatment, grabbed his arm at his hotel. The woman explained her desperate attempt to reach out to cricketers for help with the Rs 9 crore injection.

title: T20 WC: How ICC rejected BCB’s venue shift plea, issued ultimatum — what’s next
content: Bangladesh's participation in the T20 World Cup 2026 in India is uncertain after the ICC rejected their request to relocate matches. The Bangladesh Cricket Board is now in urgent talks with the government and players, who were not consulted initially. The ICC has given Bangladesh 24 hours to confirm their travel to India.

title: ‘Ridiculous’: Sanjay Raut takes ‘picnic in Davos’ jibe at Fadnavis; CM’s wife hits back
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Sanjay Raut criticized Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis' Davos visit as a 'picnic,' questioning the WEF's relevance for India and suggesting agreements could be made in Mumbai. CM's wife Amruta Fadnavis dismissed the remarks as baseless, highlighting the summit's importance for investment and employment.

title: Rupee recovers 15 paise from record low; trades at 91.50/$ in early trade
content: The rupee recovered 15 paise on Thursday, opening at 91.50 against the US dollar, rebounding from its all-time low of 91.58 hit the previous day. This modest recovery followed a sharp fall amid heightened global uncertainty, strong dollar demand, and persistent foreign portfolio outflows.

title: Zubeen Garg’s case: Assam court to hear bail pleas of five accused
content: In a significant development today, five suspects arrested in the case surrounding Zubeen Garg's unfortunate passing are appealing for bail, as the Kamrup district court prepares to evaluate their request. This plea comes in the wake of a comprehensive charge sheet issued by the Special Investigation Team, which outlines the suspects' purported roles in the incident.

title: Jaipur horror: Speeding SUV kills armed forces aspirant; driver flees
content: Tragedy struck Jaipur's Express Highway as an 18-year-old preparing for armed forces recruitment was fatally struck by a speeding SUV. Anaya Sharma, a resident of Jhotwara, was waiting by the roadside for her jogging companion when the vehicle, reportedly coming from Ajmer Road, hit her with immense force.

title: Several feared missing in landslip at New Zealand campsite
content: A devastating landslide at a New Zealand campsite has left several people missing. Emergency crews are searching through debris after the slip swept through campervans and tents. Difficult conditions and unstable ground are hampering rescue efforts as authorities work to account for everyone.

title: How Sunita Williams’ 600 days in space inspired the world
content: Sunita Williams, the trailblazing Indian-American astronaut, concluded her extraordinary 27-year journey with NASA, where she spent an astonishing 600 plus days in the cosmos. Her last mission, a spontaneous 286-day residency aboard the International Space Station, not only extended her time in space but also earned her accolades for establishing new benchmarks for female spacewalks.

title: Bus accident kills three: Tyre burst leads to fiery crash in Hyderabad
content: A devastating bus fire on the Nandyal highway claimed three lives and injured over 15 passengers after a tyre burst led to a collision with a lorry. Flames engulfed the vehicle, but a quick-thinking mini-van driver bravely rescued 36 individuals. Authorities are investigating the tragic incident, with officials offering condolences and ensuring medical aid.

title: Surat’s water tank in Rs 21-crore project collapses before inauguration
content: Eight individuals, including two government officials, were apprehended following the catastrophic collapse of a newly constructed overhead water tank in Tadkeshwar. The arrests stem from alleged criminal breach of trust and cheating. Engineering experts are now investigating the structural failure, with police awaiting their technical report to guide further actions and potential additional arrests.

title: Ganesh Chaturthi 2026: Why worshipping Heramba Ganesha can help during Saturn–Rahu pressure
content: Ganesh Chaturthi on January 22, 2026, holds special significance amidst global uncertainties and challenging planetary alignments. This auspicious day, coinciding with Magha Gupt Navaratri, is ideal for invoking Heramba Ganesha, a form known for protection against fear, job pressure, and unpredictable situations.  Worshipping Heramba Ganesha offers stability, mental calm, and steady progress.

title: Bengaluru chaat shop owner, aide kill estranged wife, hang body to fake suicide
content: A chaat shop owner and his employee were arrested for allegedly murdering the owner's estranged wife. The man confessed to strangling his wife with a rope and then enlisting his assistant to stage the scene as a suicide. The victim had filed for divorce, with the next hearing scheduled soon. Both accused are in police custody.

title: 'Amitabh Bachchan wouldn't allow anyone from the industry at his home after 8pm'
content: Actor Raja Bundela lauded Amitabh Bachchan's unwavering discipline, recounting an incident where Big B ensured a Goa shoot proceeded despite forgotten continuity shoes. Bachchan personally arranged for their overnight delivery via bus and early flight, showcasing his commitment. Bundela also highlighted Bachchan's strict work-life balance, avoiding industry gossip and maintaining family time.

title: 'Playing in India not safe' - Bangladesh's blunt warning as ICC refuses venue shift
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board president Aminul Islam Bulbul urged the ICC to shift T20 World Cup matches from India to Sri Lanka, citing safety concerns. The ICC confirmed the tournament will proceed as scheduled in India, stating independent security assessments found no threat to the Bangladesh team.

title: 'Very productive meeting': Trump backs off on Greenland tariff threat; claims deal 'framework' in place
content: US President Donald Trump has called off planned tariffs on European allies, citing a "framework for a future deal" concerning Greenland and the Arctic.  Trump announced this on Truth Social, stating the tariffs set for February 1st would not proceed. He also previously ruled out using force to acquire the island from Denmark, demanding immediate negotiations instead.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 and Sensex rally as Trump eases tariff threat - check details
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmarks, rallied strongly in opening trade on Thursday as Donald Trump’s remarks on Greenland and withdrawal of tariff threat on EU eased investors’ fears. While Nifty50 went above 25,300, BSE Sensex was up over 560 points.

title: 'Unlimited authority': Gambhir responds to Tharoor's 'hardest job after PM' remark
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor met India head coach Gautam Gambhir in Nagpur. Tharoor lauded Gambhir's challenging role, calling it the toughest after the Prime Minister's. Gambhir thanked Tharoor for his appreciation. The T20 series against New Zealand is crucial for the T20 World Cup 2026 preparations. India won the first match.

title: 65 student suicides at IITs in 5 yrs, alumni group calls for accountability
content: A recent IIT-Kanpur student suicide highlights a disturbing mental health crisis across premier Indian technical institutes, with over a dozen student deaths annually for five years. Alumni and student bodies point to intense academic pressure, isolation, and exclusion as key factors.

title: ‘Touched, hugged': AI staffer groped South Korean woman during frisking at B'luru airport; arrested
content: In a troubling incident at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport, a South Korean businesswoman reported being sexually harassed by a member of the airline's ground-handling team. The accused, lacking the authority to conduct proper security checks, reportedly inappropriately touched her and embraced her, all under the pretense of 'manual frisking' in a secluded area near the restrooms.

title: Budget 2026 expectations: What individual taxpayers are hoping for - top 4 points to know
content: Budget 2026 income tax expectations: As the government prepares for the landmark shift to the new Income-tax Act in April 2026, the Union Budget presents an opportunity to address a few long‑standing demands of individual taxpayers.

title: Muslim Man, Hindu Lover Murdered, Buried In UP, Woman's Brothers Arrested
content: In a chilling case of dishonour killing, a 27-year-old Muslim man and his 22-year-old Hindu lover were tied up and hacked to death, allegedly by the woman's brothers, in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad.

title: Sell, Steal, Repeat: US Man Arrested For Stealing Cars He Sold Online
content: Within 24 hours after the transaction, multiple buyers reported their newly purchased vehicles were stolen.

title: FIR Filed Against 5 Builders After Noida Techie's Death In Waterlogged Pit
content: Another FIR has been lodged against five builder for alleged violations of environmental and pollution laws in connection with a large waterlogged pit in Sector 150, which led to the death of a software engineer

title: Opinion: Opinion | India And Bangladesh: Are We Missing The Woods For The Trees?
content: The present bilateral disengagement between Delhi and Dhaka can lead to disastrous consequences, ones that would be difficult to undo.

title: 25-Year-Old Man Stabbed To Death In Delhi, Manhunt Underway
content: A 25-year-old man was stabbed to death in Delhi's Mangolpuri area, police said on Thursday, marking yet another violent incident reported from the national capital in recent days.

title: 60 Dead In Karachi Mall Fire: When Inferno Exposed Pakistan's Safety Failures
content: The devastating fire that tore through a shopping mall in Pakistan's largest city, Karachi, over the weekend has killed at least 61 people, including 30 who died in a single shop on the mezzanine floor of the building, authorities said.

title: How Cops Will Secure Madhya Pradesh As Basant Panchami, Friday Coincide
content: As Basant Panchami approaches, the quiet historic town of Dhar in Madhya Pradesh's Indore division has turned into a high-security grid.

title: Bhojshala: From A Temple Of Knowledge To A Theatre Of Conflict
content: Bhojshala, an 11th-century ASI-protected monument, is considered by Hindus as a temple of Goddess Saraswati, while Muslims call it Kamal Maula mosque.

title: Meitei Man Who Went To Meet Kuki Wife In Manipur Shot Dead On Camera
content: With folded hands, 28yearold Mayanglambam Rishikanta Singh kept begging for his life. Moments later, insurgents used an AK series assault rifle and shot him point blank.

title: Nagpur Student Killed By Neighbour Over Rejection. Murder Staged As Suicide
content: The investigation revealed that Prachi's neighbour, Shekhar Ajabrao Dhore, was in love with her, but she had rejected his advances.

title: Nitin Nabin Rolls Out Bengal Strategy, Targets 15 Years Of Trinamool Rule
content: Newly appointed Bharatiya Janata Party national president Nitin Nabin has wasted little time in signalling his priorities, convening his first major organisational meeting with West Bengal leaders

title: Water Rises By 20 Feet In Maharashtra's Lonar Lake, Created By Meteorite Impact
content: Shocking reports have emerged regarding a steady rise in the water levels of the world-famous Lonar Lake in Maharashtra's Buldhana district. Taking serious note of the threat, the Nagpur Bench of the Bombay High Court has ordered a PIL be registered.

title: I-PAC Got Rs 13.5 Crore Loan From A Company That Doesn't Exist, Probe On
content: Political consultancy firm I-PAC received an unsecured loan of Rs 13.5 crore in 2021 from a firm based in Rohtak that, according to official public records, had ceased to exist years earlier.

title: Bangladesh Launches Campaigns For First Post-Sheikh Hasina Polls
content: Bangladesh begins official campaigning on Thursday for hugely anticipated general elections next month, the first since the 2024 uprising ended the autocratic rule of Sheikh Hasina.

title: Several Missing After Landslides Hit New Zealand Campground
content: A landslide smashed into a campsite in rain-swept northern New Zealand on Thursday, leaving multiple people missing under tonnes of mud.

title: Rights Body Seeks Report On "Unsafe" Kashmiri Pandit "Genocide Victim Camp" In J&K
content: As the Kashmiri Pandit community completes 36 years of displacement from the Valley, the spotlight has returned to Jagti Township, where many families say "rehabilitation" has slowly turned into another endless painful ordeal.

title: Trump To Unveil 'Board of Peace' At Davos After Greenland Backtrack
content: US President Donald Trump will show off his new "Board of Peace" and meet Ukraine's leader at Davos on Thursday -- burnishing his claim to be a peacemaker a day after backing off his own threats against Greenland.

title: At Davos, IT Minister Says Homegrown AI Played Key Role In Defence Mission
content: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw revealed that a domestically developed AI model was used in a recent high-stakes defence operation and delivered "phenomenal" results - a remark widely seen as an indirect reference to Operation Sindoor.

title: "We Built Supreme Infrastructure In Andhra": Chandrababu Naidu To NDTV At Davos
content: Chandrababu Naidu is currently in Switzerland for the World Economic Forum (WEF) Annual Meeting 2026 at Davos.

title: Man Utd, Chelsea sneak through: What we learned from the League Cup semis
content: arsenal beat 10-player, seven-time champions arsenal 1-0 in their league cup final . man city have ratcheted up the pressure on the title race with their focus now almost solely on winning the WSL . despite being reigning european title holders, arsenal have squandered their first chance at clinching silverware .

title: Can Kenneth Walker III carry Seahawks to Super Bowl after Zach Charbonnet's injury?
content: Seahawks running back Zach Charbonnet missed the rest of the playoffs with a knee injury . the seahawks might not be hosting the game at Lumen Field as the conference's top seed . a successful try tied the score at 30-30 .

title: Midseason debate: Is OKC in trouble? Can the Clippers really climb in the West?
content: defending champs are vulnerable, who's lurking as surprise contenders? what's wrong with Paolo Banchero? the Oklahoma City Thunder 's slide from the 76ers to the san francisco bulldogs . defending champions donovan Mitchell scores 35 points with nine assists .

title: Buffalo fired Sean McDermott, but there's more blame to go around
content: no bad team in NFL history has ever won the Super Bowl . there's more than one good team in football every season, so luck and injuries get involved down the stretch . the bills are only the sixth team in the super Bowl era to string together seven-plus seasons of double-digit wins .

title: 💯 Arizona high schooler breaks scoring record
content: Adrian Stubbs needed just three quarters to drop 100 points in 109-25 victory at Yuma Kofa . the 5-foot-10 guard broke the previous record of 75 points held by George McCormick since 1966 . he's not on a short list for can't-miss NIL targets for major companies .

title: How to reach the UCL knockouts: Can Chelsea, Barça avoid the playoff round?
content: the knockout rounds of the 2025-26 UEFA champions league are fast approaching . the final matchweek of the league phase must be played, and the stakes could hardly be higher for some of the continent's biggest clubs . liverpool , barcelona , chelsea and manchester city also competing for top eight spots .

title: NFL execs predict 2026 moves: Lamar Jackson, A.J. Brown trades coming?
content: the Ravens' cap hit looms next season . it's like the draft -- hitting on 40-50% of first-round picks is very hard to do . the possibilities are limitless: free agency signings, retirements, contenders and pretenders .

title: 10 must-see WNBA games for the 2026 season
content: the WNBA released its 2026 regular-season schedule on friday . the league will tip off its 30th season on may 8 . at the top of the list is a new CBA . a moratorium on league business as negotiations continue .

title: Prince Harry fights back tears as he speaks about media scrutiny on Meghan Markle
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: Net FDI negative for fourth month in a row in November 2025, outflows exceed inflows by $446 million
content: Net foreign portfolio investments have also been negative so far in the financial year 2025-26, with uncertainty over the India-U.S. trade deal and the weakening rupee affecting investor confidence

title: Andhra Government to spend over ₹75 crore to renovate 57 temples in Nellore
content: Endowments Minister Anam Ramanarayana Reddy plans to set up a 100-acre solar power project in the lands of Narasimha Swamy temple

title: Notice issued to singer Neha Singh Rathore in Varanasi case over remarks on PM Modi
content: Lanka police station in-charge Rajkumar Sharma said a case was registered against folk singer Neha Singh Rathore in 2025 on charges of making derogatory comments about the Prime Minister

title: Cold conditions grip Kashmir; snowfall likely
content: “There was a decrease in night temperatures at most places in Kashmir and the mercury settled below the freezing point across the valley,” officials said

title: Karnataka governor vs government: Opposition leaders criticise Congress over scenes in House
content: Mr. Ashok alleged that Law and Parliamentary Affairs Minister H.K. Patil had attempted to “block the Governor’s way” inside the Assembly and demanded that action be taken.

title: J&K woman officer to command all-male CRPF marching contingent on Republic Day
content: Simran Bala, for the first time, will command a party of more than 140 male personnel during the annual national event

title: Supreme Court issues notice to Delhi government on plea of LeT terrorist against death penalty in 2000 Red Fort case
content: LeT terrorist Mohammad Arif was awarded the death sentence for the 2000 Red Fort attack that killed three  Army jawans

title: Fresh encounter breaks out in J&K’s Kishtwar
content: A fresh contact was established with the holed up terrorists in the dense forests of Singhpora on Thursday (January 22, 2026) morning, officials said

title: A total of 167 drug samples flagged as 'not of standard quality' in December 2025: Health Ministry
content: The list of NSQ and spurious drugs is put up on the CDSCO portal on a monthly basis as part of routine regulatory surveillance activity

title: Noida techie death: Fresh FIR against builders for flouting environment pollution laws
content: The FIR has been lodged even as a Special Investigation Team (SIT) formed by the Uttar Pradesh government on Thursday (January 22, 2026) continued its probe into the matter on the third day

title: Karnataka Governor Gehlot reads just two lines of his address in Legislature session, CM calls it ‘violation of Constitution’
content: This is the third face-off between a governor and a state government in the past two days in non BJP-ruled states.

title: 1984 anti-Sikh riots: Delhi court acquits Sajjan Kumar in Vikaspuri, Janakpuri violence case
content: In August 2023, a court had charged Sajjan Kumar with rioting and promoting enmity, while discharging him of murder and criminal conspiracy offences

title: Can Bharathapuzha river in Kerala survive Maha Magha, dubbed ‘Kumbh of the South’?
content: The days leading up to the inauguration of its modern ode have been punctuated with religio-political tensions. Yet, beneath the spiritual, cultural, and political contestations lies a more pressing concern: How will the already fragile Bharathapuzha sustain a recurring Kumbh-scale event?

title: Kerala Assembly adjourned amid uproar over Sabarimala gold theft controversy
content: Opposition seeks resignation of Devaswom Minister V.N. Vasavan and expulsion of Travancore Devaswom Board president

title: Amruta Fadnavis hits back at Sanjay Raut, says ‘my husband in Davos not for picnic’
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis is in Davos to participate in the World Economic Forum annual meeting

title: Watch: The Hindu Editorial | Meaningless formality: On Governors, their actions
content: The actions of the Tamil Nadu and Kerala Governors during their Assembly addresses on January 20 have triggered a fresh constitutional debate. Chief Ministers accused the Governors of skipping, altering or refusing to read Cabinet-approved speeches, violating long-standing conventions.

title: Kerala prisoners’ wage hike draws fire; government defends move
content: Decision draws flak particularly since it comes in run-up to Assembly elections. Critics highlight disparity of wages provided to workers in other sectors

title: First ‘Made in India’ C-295 aircraft expected to roll out of factory before September: Jaishankar
content: In his remarks at a meeting with Spanish Foreign Minister Jose Manuel Albares, Mr. Jaishankar asserted that the world must display “zero tolerance” towards terrorism

title: Bengaluru hospital performs combined robotic heart bypass and prostate cancer surgery in a single operative session
content: Although combining two major surgeries under a single anaesthesia is rare, in this case, it significantly helped avoid multiple major surgeries and hospital admissions, repeated exposure to anaesthesia, prolonged recovery and high risk

title: India ‘stopped’ buying oil from Russia, claims U.S. Treasury Secretary
content: “India started buying Russian oil after the (Ukraine) conflict began, but President Trump put a 25% tariff on them, and India has geared down and has stopped buying Russian oil,” says Mr. Bessent

title: Essential to forge alliance with Left, Congress at the earliest to defeat Trinamool, BJP, says Nawshad Siddique
content: The Communist Party of India (Marxist) led Left Front, Congress and ISF had forged an alliance with the ISF in the 2021 Assembly polls but the alliance did not result in much electoral success

title: Should corruption charges need prior sanction? | Explained
content: What does Section 17A of the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988 mandate? Why was there a split verdict on deciding whether Section 17A was constitutionally valid? What do earlier rulings by the Supreme Court state? What are the systemic reforms needed to tackle corruption among public officials?

title: A fight over figures: the constitutional debate over numerals
content: A forgotten but fiery debate in the Constituent Assembly once pitted cultural pride against pragmatic modernity over something as simple as numerals. This controversy reminds us how even digits became symbols of identity and plurality

title: Three charred to death in bus accident in Nandyal district
content: There were nearly 36 passengers in the bus at the time of accident and some of them suffered injuries

title: Tiger from Telangana enters Eluru District; Forest Department on high alert
content: The pugmarks indicate the tiger may be retracing its route back toward Telangana through which it entered the district

title: IPE-The Hindu FIC college quiz in Hyderabad on January 27
content: The Hyderabad event will be held at Sundarayya Vignana Kendram, Bagh Lingampally and quiz is open and free for all undergraduate students below the age of 28

title: Revanth-led delegation successfully convinces investors at WEF meet, explaining Telangana’s proactive policies
content: Telangana Chief Minister pitches for investments on the strength of roadmap for realising US $ 3 trillion economy

title: Minister urges coordination for timely Ramzan arrangements
content: Mr. Azharuddin was chairing a review meeting with district minorities welfare officers on Wednesday where he underscored the need for Ramzan preparations

title: Caste survey report before Feb. 10, says Minister
content: Tangadagi claimed that Chief Minister Siddaramaiah had responded to the needs of the communities, and has released ₹1,600 crore to all development corporations

title: Shivraj Singh Chouhan to coach BJP-JD(S) on new job scheme
content: Sources in the BJP said that the party State leadership had requested the Centre to depute Mr. Chouhan to Karnataka to provide orientation to the Opposition members

title: India, E.U. agree to sign security and defence partnership next week: Kaja Kallas
content: Kallas noted that the E.U. is among India’s largest trading partners and described India as “indispensable” to Europe’s economic resilience

title: Ladki Bahin scheme: 1.57 crore continue to receive aid; 86 lakh beneficiaries dropped
content: Maharashtra government announced to carry out physical verification of over 24 lakhs rejected beneficiaries

title: Odisha to conduct polls for 24 new civic bodies in June end
content: State Election Commissioner Madhusudan Padhi on Wednesday (January 21, 2026) said it was mandatory to complete the electoral process within six months of the declaration of any municipal area

title: MLB offseason grades: Mets get their ace in blockbuster deal for Peralta
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . Bradford Doolittle and David Schoenfield will evaluate each move as it happens, so check back in for the freshest analysis through the start of spring training .

title: 'Let's bomb more countries!': Row over Machado saying Cuba and Nicaragua will be 'freed'
content: a pathetic puppet of the gang deliberately confusing tyranny with freedom to justify further conquest of the Americas in line with a veracity . 'won’t tolerate Imperialist...’: Mexico, Cuba Cross Swords With US Over ‘Illegal Venezuela Rule’ .

title: Way-Too-Early Top 25: Sizing up the top contenders for next season
content: the Hoosiers are the first team to go 16-0 in a season in the modern era . the top five is full of familiar names: Indiana, Notre Dame, no. 4 Georgia and no. 5 Oregon .

title: Rajasthan approves draft Bill to restrict property transfer in ‘disturbed areas’ to address communal tension
content: Law Minister Jogaram Patel said after the Cabinet meeting in Jaipur that the areas affected by violence, mob unrest, or “improper clustering” — with a change in demographic profile — could be declared as disturbed

title: Naidu proposes Israel Industrial Park and Dubai Food Cluster in A.P.
content: The Chief Minister meets several key leaders from Israel, UAE and Switzerland, seeking investment tie-ups with Andhra Pradesh

title: Camps will be organised at block and panchayat level once a month to give ‘life certificate’: Bihar Minister
content: Beneficiaries’ number under Social Security Pension Scheme increased to 1.16 crore in 2025 from 12 lakh in 2005

title: ‘Freebies’ different from public welfare investment, says Supreme Court
content: Supreme Court asks why there is no dedicated diversion of revenue surplus for developmental purposes, which would further the constitutional ideal of inclusivity through free medical care and education for the poor

title: Karnataka Governor likely to skip portions of text in his address to State legislature
content: Thaawarchand Gehlot has expressed reservations over 11 paragraphs in the speech prepared by the Congress government in Karnataka; these paragraphs include strong criticism of the Central government for introducing the VB-G RAM G Act

title: CAQM submits long-term steps to curb air pollution; Supreme Court asks Delhi authorities to act
content: The measures include phasing out polluting vehicles from Delhi-NCR, fortifying the pollution-under-check regime, augmentation of rail transport and metro models, revised electric vehicle policy, etc.

title: Why are landless tribals and farmers protesting in Maharashtra? | The Hindu Explains
content: Thousands of farmers and tribals from areas like Vasai, and the tehsils of Palghar, including Charoti, Manor, Wada, Vikramgad, Talasari, and Mokhed, participated in the “long march” protest led by Communist Party of India (Marxist) from Charoti to Palghar Collector office covering about 60 km on foot. The protest started on January 19, 2026, and continued on January 20, 2026 at the Palghar Collector office, where the demonstrators will stay till all the demands are fulfilled. What are their demands?

title: Opposition slams transfer of magistrate who ordered FIR against cops in Sambhal violence case
content: Sambhal CJM Vibhanshu Sudheer transferred to Sultanpur as Civil Judge (Senior Division) days after the FIR direction; “politically motivated”, says Congress; undermines judicial independence, say lawyers

title: Supreme Court tells States to frame policy on police media briefing in three months
content: The manual prepared by the amicus curiae upholds the integrity of investigations, noting that the police “communicate to prevent harm, correct rumours, enlist public cooperation and maintain law and order”

title: Madras High Court accepts Chennai Corporation’s revised layout map restricting number of shops in Marina beach to 300
content: Justices R. Suresh Kumar and A.D. Jagadish Chandira appoint retired Chief Justice N. Paul Vasanthakumar to monitor drawal of lots for allotment of those shops

title: Dhaka declared ‘non-family’ station due to ‘deteriorating’ security situation: Indian officials
content: This is a precautionary measure due to the threat of mob attacks against Indian missions, officials say, with tensions rising ahead of the February 12 election; will not hurt diplomatic, consular activities

title: Lancet experts call for a ‘citizen-centric’ healthcare delivery and use of technology
content: The commission said with “WHO facing serious difficulties and the U.S. Government in retreat from global health”, India can be “an even stronger voice for the Global South and promote a more equitable distribution of power in a multipolar global order”

title: Hical Technologies rolls out ‘Corporate Commute’ to encourage employees to shift to public transport in Bengaluru
content: The STAMP challenge is led by WRI India and the Toyota Mobility Foundation, with support from industry and transport stakeholders including ELCIA, ELCITA, BMRCL and BMTC

title: Government mulls over Trump Gaza board invitation, as leaders of Israel, UAE, and Pakistan join
content: Sources say Arab leaders to be consulted at conference on January 30-31; Modi expected to travel to West Asia, Israel soon

title: Indian start-ups can lead solutions to global challenges, says V-P
content: Vice-President C.P. Radhakrishnan said India was racing towards becoming a Viksit Bharat by 2047 and that the nation’s youth would play a decisive role in realising this vision

title: Controversy erupts in U.P. over notice to religious leader over use of ‘Shankaracharya’ title
content: The tug of war between the authorities and Mr. Saraswati started during the Magh Mela, an annual month-long religious fair in which devotees assemble at the Triveni Sangam, the confluence of the rivers Ganga, Yamuna, and the mythical Saraswati, for a holy dip

title: Cabinet nod for ₹404-crore second phase of Chellanam seawall project
content: Funds for the project will be mobilised through the Kerala Infrastructure Investment Fund Board, while Kerala Irrigation Infrastructure Development Corporation Limited has been assigned as the special purpose vehicle to implement the project

title: Stormy session likely on new job scheme and more
content: While Congress has said that VB-G RAM G Act that replaces MGNREGA weakens livelihood security, Opposition BJP and JD(S) has insisted that it is aimed at correcting issues in the old scheme

title: Bengaluru Suburban Rail Project deadline pushed to 2030 from Oct. 2026
content: It was sanctioned in October 2020 after decades of deliberation and was envisioned as a high-capacity commuter rail system carrying nearly 20 lakh passengers daily

title: All six stanzas of Vande Mataram to get the spotlight in Culture Ministry’s Republic Day tableau
content: In Parliament, PM had accused the Congress of “sabotage”, sowing the seeds of Partition by adopting only the first two stanzas as the national song
